Origin: Yirgacheffe growing region, Gedeo Zone, southern Ethiopia
Origin_String: Yirgacheffe growing region, Gedeo Zone, southern Ethiopia
Name: Ethiopia Baraka Buna
Review: A pungent, intricate darker-roasted Ethiopia Yirgacheffe, lushly floral in front with an engagingly bittersweet, savory-edged depth.

Name: Dreamlands Blend
Review: Unusual juxtaposition of aromatic wood, flowers and cocoa animate a zesty, bittersweet medium-dark-roasted blend.

Origin: Yirgacheffe growing region, Gedeo Zone, southern Ethiopia
Origin_String: Yirgacheffe growing region, Gedeo Zone, southern Ethiopia
Name: Ethiopia Yirgacheffe Aricha
Review: A delicate, floral-and-cocoa wet-processed Ethiopia turned richly crisp by a tactful darker roast.

Origin: Lintong growing region, northern Sumatra, Indonesia
Origin_String: Lintong growing region, northern Sumatra, Indonesia
Name: Sumatra Narata Nauli
Review: An authentic “forest floor” style of Sumatra coffee brought to a briskly decisive darker roast, enriching without obscuring its pleasing earthy idiosyncrasy.

Origin: Kochere, Yirgacheffe growing region, south-central Ethiopia
Origin_String: Kochere, Yirgacheffe growing region, south-central Ethiopia
Name: Washed Ethiopia Yirgacheffe Banko Gotiti
Review: An elegant, crisply high-toned, floral-driven washed Yirgacheffe with a cocoa throughline.

Origin: Lintong growing region, North Sumatra Province, Sumatra, Indonesia
Origin_String: Lintong growing region, North Sumatra Province, Sumatra, Indonesia
Name: Sumatra Danau Toba
Review: A classic wet-hulled Sumatra, equal parts floral- and earth-toned, with rich aromatic wood and chocolate notes throughout.

Name: Kapsakiso Kenya
Review: An enticing, classic Kenya: bright, juicy, crisp, powerful yet finely balanced.

Origin: Shakiso growing district, Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Origin_String: Shakiso growing district, Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Name: Ethiopia Oromia
Review: This natural-processed Ethiopia cup is an engaging study in contrasts: sweetly fermenty fruit notes juxtaposed with suggestions of gently scorched aromatic wood.

Origin: Kalehe, South Kivu Province, Democratic Republic of the Congo
Origin_String: Kalehe, South Kivu Province, Democratic Republic of the Congo
Name: Congo Natural
Review: A crisp, spice-framed Congo natural with suggestions of rich almond notes throughout the profile.

Origin: Odo Shakiso District, Guji Zone, southern Ethiopia
Origin_String: Odo Shakiso District, Guji Zone, southern Ethiopia
Name: Ethiopia Washed Kayon Mountain
Review: A sumptuous washed Ethiopia cup with absorbing and intricate floral, fruit and chocolate notes throughout.

Name: Ethiopia Yirgacheffe
Review: An attractive washed Yirgacheffe, peachy sweet and spicy-savory.

Name: Static Ethiopia Konga Washed
Review: A medium-dark roast nicely develops this wet-processed Ethiopia’s chocolate and spice notes. A good choice for those who enjoy strongly stated profiles.

Name: Ninety Plus Gesha Estates Limited Batch #227
Review: An extraordinarily original coffee, both in story (Gesha variety, unorthodox processing) and in its stunning aromatics, both intricately complex, yet grandly and resonantly complete.

Name: Our Blend Espresso
Review: A deeply sweet, spice-inflected blend with pleasing roast notes that suggest cedar.

Name: Adado Shara Ethiopia Washed
Review: A crisply high-toned washed Ethiopia coffee offering a fine balance of sweet fruit and aromatic wood notes.

Origin: Lintong growing region, North Sumatra Province, Sumatra, Indonesia
Origin_String: Lintong growing region, North Sumatra Province, Sumatra, Indonesia
Name: Tano Batak Sumatra
Review: An enigmatic, deep Sumatra cup, with classic layering of lush fruit and foresty notes of tobacco, orchid and fresh earth.

Name: Makwa Kenya AB
Review: A resonantly engaging Kenya cup: smoothly bright acidity, sweet fruit and floral notes and a deep, savory throughline.

Origin: Sabanilla de Alajuela growing region, Costa Rica
Origin_String: Sabanilla de Alajuela growing region, Costa Rica
Name: Calle San Juan Costa Rica Honey
Review: A balanced, sweet-toned Costa Rica cup with a spicy floral notes thorughout.

Origin: Odo Shakiso District, Guji Zone, southern Ethiopia
Origin_String: Odo Shakiso District, Guji Zone, southern Ethiopia
Name: Ethiopia Kayon Mountain Natural
Review: A sweet-toned natural Ethiopia cup with elegantly engaging floral and dried fruit notes.

Name: Honey-Processed Coffee
Review: A crisply sweet, brisk cup that is wood-framed with gentle fruit and floral complications throughout.

Name: Finca El Guamo Colombia
Review: A deeply engaging floral-toned Colombia cup with suggestions of chocolate and succulent stone fruit throughout, as well as hints of savory spice.

Origin: Kalehe, South Kivu Province, Democratic Republic of the Congo
Origin_String: Kalehe, South Kivu Province, Democratic Republic of the Congo
Name: Congo Lake Kivu Kavisa Bourbon
Review: Chocolate, flower and black pepper notes carry pleasingly through this sweetly rich Congo cup.

Origin: Odo Shakiso District, Guji Zone, southern Ethiopia
Origin_String: Odo Shakiso District, Guji Zone, southern Ethiopia
Name: Ethiopia Natural Guji Kayon Mountain
Review: An intense, delicately rich dried-in-the-fruit, natural-processed Ethiopia cup, with an invitingly sweet-tart structure.

Name: Kolombian
Review: A tactful darker-roasted coffee with deep chocolate notes throughout, complicated by raisin and sweet floral hints.

Name: Kenya Ndaroini AA
Review: A particularly deep-toned version of Kenya’s characteristic style of sweet-tart fruit and lively, bright acidity.

Name: El Salvador Finca Kilimanjaro Natural
Review: Another compelling Aida Batlle coffee from her El Salvador farm, with deep fruit and cocoa tones and spicy floral notes throughout.

Name: Gitesi Rwanda
Review: A crisp, refreshing Rwanda coffee with deep sweetness and hints of savory spice.

Origin: Murang’a Foothills, Aberdare Ridge, Central Province, Kenya
Origin_String: Murang’a Foothills, Aberdare Ridge, Central Province, Kenya
Name: Kamagogo Kenya
Review: Complex, intensely pungent, deeply sweet-savory. Concord grape, honey, marjoram, narcissus, blood orange zest in aroma and cup. Juicy, engaging acidity; plush, syrupy mouthfeel. The resonant, long, flavor-laden finish sustains all of the notes from the cup plus a cinnamon-like hint of spice.

Name: Twisted 4.0 Espresso
Review: A compelling, cocoa- and floral-toned espresso with spice notes throughout, both in the straight shot and in milk.

Name: El Salvador Finca Kilimanjaro Cascara Fermentation Aida Batlle
Review: The originality of this sweetly intricate, multilayered cup is doubtless owing both to a distinguished tree variety – Kenya’s famous SL28 – as well as to an innovative processing wrinkle involving conducting the fermentation step in an infusion of cascara, or the dried husk of the coffee fruit.

Name: Rwanda Nyampinga
Review: A sweet, floral-toned Rwanda cup with ballast from tart citrus and savory aromatic wood notes.

Name: Jarama Rwanda
Review: An accessible, sweet-toned Rwanda coffee saturated with spicy floral complication.

Name: El Salvador La Loma Gloria Washed
Review: An accessible, balanced, crisply sweet cup offering quiet aromatic surprises.

Origin: Ka’u growing region, Big Island of Hawaii
Origin_String: Ka’u growing region, Big Island of Hawaii
Name: Ka’u Natural Typica
Review: A dried-in-the-fruit or natural cup that engages by way of sweet florals and appealing tart fruit notes.

Name: Loma La Gloria Natural
Review: Blueberry central! A fruit-toned natural cup that paradoxically conjures sherry-like wine enveloped in dark chocolate.

Name: Rwanda Twongere Umusaruro
Review: A complex Rwanda cup that rewards patience with an unfolding of sweet fruit and floral notes juxtaposed with suggestions of savory herbs.

Name: Kenya Nyeri Kiamaina PB
Review: Poised between rich sweetness and bold savory tones, this Kenya is refined and deeply satisfying.

Name: Rwanda Nyampinga
Review: A Rwanda tactfully roasted to the dark edge of medium; chocolate-centered with floral and spice notes complicated by a hint of smoky aromatic wood.

Name: Montaña de Abi Anny Ruth El Salvador
Review: An inviting dried-in-the-fruit or “natural” coffee from El Salvador, crisply spice-toned and fruit-forward.

Origin: Kalehe, South Kivu Province, Democratic Republic of the Congo
Origin_String: Kalehe, South Kivu Province, Democratic Republic of the Congo
Name: Congo Muungano
Review: An intriguing Congo cup from a cooperative that is leading the recovery of the Kivu region from civil war, and a sensory gift for those who enjoy savory-leaning coffees complicated and deepened by berry and citrus notes.

Name: Colombia La Palma Y El Tucan Gesha
Review: An almost shockingly original Gesha cup, intense, surprising and intricate in its layered aromatics, brisk yet sweet in structure.

Origin: Puna District, Big Island of Hawaii
Origin_String: Puna District, Big Island of Hawaii
Name: Puna Natural
Review: A natural-processed coffee that exhibits grace and finesse in its fruit-forward elegance.

Name: El Salvador Anny Ruth Red Honey
Review: A classic and inviting Central America cup: crisp, sweet, balanced, plush.

Name: Static Tio Emilio Pichincha Ecuador
Review: An accessible, high-toned coffee with inviting pear, vanilla-like florals and aromatic wood notes.

Name: Selected Medium Roast Espresso
Review: A solid espresso with a throughline of dark chocolate and citrus zest. Especially compelling in milk, where chocolate notes intensify, supported by vanilla-like floral tones.

Name: Selected Full City Roast Espresso
Review: An accessible, rich, chocolate-toned espresso with hints of orange zest throughout.

Origin: Holualoa, North Kona growing district, “Big Island” of Hawaii
Origin_String: Holualoa, North Kona growing district, “Big Island” of Hawaii
Name: Bourbon Peaberry
Review: Unusual, pleasing and wide-ranging in aroma and flavor, from chocolate to citrus blossom and savory spice to hints of tropical fruit.

Origin: Lintong growing region, North Sumatra Province, Sumatra, Indonesia
Origin_String: Lintong growing region, North Sumatra Province, Sumatra, Indonesia
Name: Sumatra Boru Batak
Review: A flavor-saturated Sumatra with lively citrus, elegant fruit and lush tobacco notes.

Name: Kenya Marumi AA
Review: An appealing Kenya cup, driven by berry and spice notes and vanilla-like florals.

Name: Competition Espresso
Review: A sweetly pungent, complex, floral-toned shot; in milk, chocolate-laden with suggestions of coconut.

Name: Espresso Blend #01 Full City Roast
Review: An appealing blend for those who value a sweet, roast-toned straight shot that is softened and enlivened in cappuccino-sized milk.

Name: Burundi Kayanza Kabuye Mpanga Natural
Review: An original Burundi coffee, unusual both for its processing method (dried-in-the-fruit or natural; most Burundi coffee is wet-processed or washed) and its striking floral-toned acidity.

Name: 100% Arabica Coffee from Puerto Rico
Review: Satisfying chocolate and nut notes nearly carry the day in this briskly bittersweet coffee from Puerto Rico.

Name: Gesha Village Estate Bench Maji Gesha G1
Review: An elegant washed Gesha from Ethiopia: juicy, delicately intense, flower-driven.

Name: Pink Bourbon Colombia Cauca
Review: A deep, sweet-savory Colombia cup with inviting chocolate and tart-fruit notes.

Name: Barrel Proof
Review: Not a conventional coffee profile, but a striking one. The influence of the whiskey-casking dominates, but lushly, complexly, rather originally.

Name: Barrel-Aged Coffee
Review: This very sensitively light-roasted coffee offers a delicate, refreshing take on spirits barrel-conditioned coffee.

Name: Wine-Barrel-Aged Ethiopia
Review: This complex expression of delicate but powerfully aromatic green coffee, a hint of wine-toned alcohol and distinct roast notes should please those who like a roasty but nuanced and original cup.

Name: Bourbon-Barrel-Aged Kenya Baragu
Review: A resonant, complexly layered, quite original cup.

Origin: Apaneca-Ilamatapec growing region, western El Salvador
Origin_String: Apaneca-Ilamatapec growing region, western El Salvador
Name: Pinot Noir-Aged El Salvador
Review: Balanced, quietly zesty; the wine gently but explicitly complicates acidity and flavor in this graceful El Salvador.

Origin: Puna District, Big Island of Hawaii
Origin_String: Puna District, Big Island of Hawaii
Name: Puna Theobroma Coffee
Review: A beverage of contrasts. Lush but crisp in its floral- and cocoa-toned aromatics; sweet but bracingly bitterish and dry in structure. The aromatics prevail in a smooth, refreshing finish.

Origin: Dolok Sanggul, Lintong growing region, North Sumatra, Indonesia
Origin_String: Dolok Sanggul, Lintong growing region, North Sumatra, Indonesia
Name: Aged Sumatra Ulos Batak Peaberry
Review: The great wet-hulled Sumatra profile takes on a particularly graceful resonance in this traditionally aged version.

Name: Espresso Havana
Review: An expressive espresso blend that unfurls with deep chocolate, sweet floral and tart fruit notes over hints of smoky aromatic wood.

Name: Static Rio Negro Colombia
Review: A sweetly herbaceous, crisp, cocoa-toned Colombia cup.

Name: Static Santa Luzia Brazil
Review: An accessible, sweetly nut- and spice-toned Brazil cup.

Name: Colombia La Palma and El Tucan Espresso
Review: A bright yet lush straight shot that expresses its complexity with particular conviction in cappuccino-sized milk.

Name: Ninety Plus Estate Panama Gesha Lycello
Review: A big-bodied, high-toned, crisply sweet Panama Gesha that resonates with citrus and cocoa notes throughout.

Name: Costa Rica Microlot White Honey
Review: Attractive darker-roasted Costa Rica, pungent and chocolaty with a zesty orange edge.

Name: Hopper Blend Espresso
Review: Crisply roasty, while maintaining plush body and an attractive set of fruit, chocolate and floral notes.

Name: Peru Rayos del Sol Single Farm
Review: A straightforward cup with an appealing throughline of sweet nut and fruit tones and gentle acidity.

Name: Ethiopia Tawo Mok
Review: A crisply sweet, ripe-berry-driven Yirgacheffe cup with attractive chocolate tones throughout.

Name: Dharma Blend Espresso
Review: An engaging espresso blend for its sweet floral and crisp fruit tones, all ensconced in notes of dark chocolate that develop with particular appeal in milk.

Name: Flight Seasonal Espresso
Review: A powerhouse Ethiopia espresso blend with a floral-tart composure that maintains its complexity and intensity in both straight shot and milk.

Name: Kenya Kabare AA
Review: A commanding Kenya coffee: sophisticated yet playful, with tropical fruit and sweet floral tones in harmonious balance.

Origin: Sidama (also Sidamo) growing region, southern Ethiopia
Origin_String: Sidama (also Sidamo) growing region, southern Ethiopia
Name: Ethiopia Sidamo Mulish
Review: An essentially sweet natural Sidamo cup with savory depth and a crisp, spice-toned throughline.

Name: Milepost Peru Rayos del Sol
Review: For those who enjoy the virtues of decidedly light-roasted coffees, this Peru offers a delicately floral cup with high-toned cacao notes throughout.

Name: Three Pillars Blend
Review: A lovely breakfast-style blend with gentle ripe-fruit tones (the honey-processed coffees in the blend?) animated by a sweetly tart vivacity.

Name: Costa Rica Sonoran Estate Red Catuai
Review: A delightfully balanced Costa Rica cup, classic in its expression of crisp, gentle acidity and ripe fruit and sweet floral notes.

Origin: Matas de Minas growing region, Minas Gerais State, Brazil
Origin_String: Matas de Minas growing region, Minas Gerais State, Brazil
Name: Brazil Matas de Minas
Review: A pleasing, accessible cup for those who enjoy mild, sweetly nut- and chocolate-toned Brazils.

Name: Gesha, Gesha Village 1931
Review: A deeply inviting natural Gesha cup, splendidly structured and fulfilling in its range of clean fruit and floral tones sustained from aroma to finish.

Name: Ntrambo Burundi
Review: An enticingly unusual coffee in general, but a classic in the Burundi sense: crisp, simultaneously sweet and savory-tart, as well as high-toned.

Name: Aricha Yirgacheffe Ethiopia
Review: A very cleanly expressed dried-in-the-fruit Yirgacheffe cup, richly spice-toned with deeply sweet floral notes.

Name: Rock the House Blend
Review: A fine but affordable blend characterized by both its sweet delicacy and rich depth.

Name: Rwanda Bufcafe Espresso
Review: An intriguing espresso for those who enjoy an unapologetically savory-inclined structure, softened and animated by an dark chocolate and orange zest sweetness.

Name: Tolima Colombia
Review: A crisply sweet-savory cup, with a throughline of rich chocolate and sweetly tart fruit notes.

Name: Ethiopia Yirgacheffe Kochore
Review: A deeply rich, very sweetly pungent coffee, driven by notes of flowers and stone fruit: a classic Yirgacheffe cup.

Name: Rwanda Kivu Rutsiro District
Review: An accessible, sweet Rwanda cup with appealing berry and bittersweet citrus notes in aroma and flavor.

Origin: Cobán region, Alta Verapaz Department, Guatemala
Origin_String: Cobán region, Alta Verapaz Department, Guatemala
Name: Guatemala Finca Cappuccino “Echo-Lot” Espresso
Review: A deeply rich, sweet-tart shot, driven by floral and dark chocolate; lush and inviting in milk.

Name: Ethiopia Guji Shakiso Danbi Uddo
Review: A gently bright, exuberant washed Ethiopia cup: classically sweet, richly tart, intricately aromatic.

Name: Ethiopia Guji Double-Washed
Review: An intricately composed, delicate, crisply sweet Ethiopia with zesty citrus tones throughout.

Name: Giakanja Kenya
Review: An intense, confident Kenya cup that will appeal to those who like savory-leaning yet sweet-toned coffees.

Name: Ethiopia Washed Kochere
Review: A graceful, pretty washed Ethiopia cup with deep floral notes up front, grounded by cocoa and citrus tones.

Name: Kenya Kamoini Othaya
Review: Pushes the envelope on classic Kenya sweet-savory balance, leaning more toward the savory, though its tart, spicy core is saturated throughout by floral and cocoa notes.

Name: Ethiopia Harrar Natural G3 Longberry
Review: A lovely medium-dark roasted coffee showing deep fruit- and floral-toned sweetness from aroma to finish.

Origin: Lintong growing region, North Sumatra Province, Sumatra, Indonesia
Origin_String: Lintong growing region, North Sumatra Province, Sumatra, Indonesia
Name: Sumatra Dolok Sanguul
Review: A rich, spicy-sweet Sumatra with cocoa tones and suggestions of vanilla-like flowers throughout.

Origin: Guji Zone, Sidama (also Sidamo) growing region, southern Ethiopia
Origin_String: Guji Zone, Sidama (also Sidamo) growing region, southern Ethiopia
Name: Ethiopia Shakiso, Mora Mora
Review: An unusually clean and poised natural-processed Ethiopia cup, sweetly crisp and buoyant.

Name: Kenya AA Gura Auction Lot
Review: A classic Kenya cup: sweetly tart, delicately herbaceous, flavor-saturated from aroma to finish.

Name: Espresso #6
Review: A blend of three highly regarded coffees that come together as a an impressively floral-toned, resonant straight shot, and present as pleasingly bittersweet and fruit-toned in milk.

Origin: Holualoa, North Kona growing district, “Big Island” of Hawaii
Origin_String: Holualoa, North Kona growing district, “Big Island” of Hawaii
Name: 100% Kona Bourbon Pointu Laurina
Review: An exciting and rare coffee with an extraordinarily bright acidity and broad aromatic scope.

Name: Yirgacheffe G1 Idido
Review: An elegant, resonant washed Yirgacheffe cup, classic in its deeply sweet, flower-driven character.

Name: SHB Winey Microlot Panama Hartmann
Review: A delicate natural-processed Panama cup with a hint of fruit-toned sweet ferment.

Origin: Sabanilla de Alajuela growing region, Costa Rica
Origin_String: Sabanilla de Alajuela growing region, Costa Rica
Name: Flight Seasonal Espresso
Review: A compelling dried-in-the-fruit Central America espresso, particularly attractive in milk.

Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, Sidama Province, Ethiopia
Origin_String: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, Sidama Province, Ethiopia
Name: Ethiopia Gigesa Natural
Review: An appealing natural-processed Ethiopia cup with a crisp but lush, edge-of-fermenty fruit.

Origin: Lintong growing region, North Sumatra Province, Sumatra, Indonesia
Origin_String: Lintong growing region, North Sumatra Province, Sumatra, Indonesia
Name: Sumatra Highlands Lintong Batak
Review: Will appeal to those who value the classic Sumatra wet-hulled profile, with sweet fruit and spicy floral notes complicating a throughline of rich pipe tobacco.

Name: Panama Don Pachi Natural
Review: A fruit-forward Panama cup with a crisp, lively throughline of fragrant aromatic wood.

Name: Yemen Asrar Haraz
Review: A distinct strawberry note, somewhere between strawberry jam and strawberry guava, sweetly contrasting with a slightly pungent, oaky crispness, give this coffee its unusual character.

Name: Yemen Port of Mokha Hayma Microlot
Review: An exquisitely composed Yemen coffee, almost other-worldly in its array of fruit and floral notes, all enveloped in a crisp chocolate.

Origin: San Adolfo, Acevedo, Huila Department, Colombia
Origin_String: San Adolfo, Acevedo, Huila Department, Colombia
Name: Edgar Motta Colombia Pink Bourbon
Review: A Colombia coffee with an exhilarating range of sensation: both delicate and juicy, floral and spice-toned.

Name: Colombia Gustavo de Jesus Rivera Microlot
Review: A confident, juicy-sweet Colombia coffee, satisfyingly complete in structure and lively in aromatics.

Origin: Odo Shakiso District, Guji Zone, southern Ethiopia
Origin_String: Odo Shakiso District, Guji Zone, southern Ethiopia
Name: Ethiopia Guji Suke Quto Honey
Review: A pretty honey-processed Ethiopia cup for those who value deep sweetness animated by appealing cocoa and spice notes.

Origin: Limu Woreda, Oromia Zone, southern Ethiopia
Origin_String: Limu Woreda, Oromia Zone, southern Ethiopia
Name: Ethiopia Limu Kossa Geshe
Review: A decidedly fruit-centered natural-processed Ethiopia, with a tasteful edge of sweet ferment.

Name: Kenya Nyeri Giakanja AA
Review: An attractive Kenya cup for those who enjoy a bold, tart-leaning acidity, with a bright sweetness emerging beneath its initial assertion.

Name: Kenya Kangocho
Review: A lush, aromatically bold Kenya cup: floral-toned with deep fruit notes and rich savory resonance.

Name: Kenya Othaya
Review: Classically Kenya: sweet, tart and deeply savory all at once, resonating around floral-toned herb and pungent berry notes.

Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Origin_String: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Name: Ethiopia Kayon Mountain
Review: A cocoa-and fruit-toned natural-processed Ethiopia with a pleasantly brandy-toned hint of sweet ferment.

Name: Kenya AA Top Kirinyaga
Review: Should please lovers of the classic Kenya style: big, juicy and sweet-savory in structure, pungently berry- and lavender-toned in aromatics.

Name: Ethiopia Celinga
Review: An accessible washed Ethiopia cup, sweetly balanced and gently animated by floral and spice notes.

Origin: Papua New Guinea; Burundi; Ethiopia; Kenya
Origin_String: Papua New Guinea; Burundi; Ethiopia; Kenya
Name: B People Blend
Review: A compelling and quietly original blend, unusual in that it contains coffees from four origins roasted to different levels and combined, much like a cuvee in the wine industry.

Origin: Waghi Valley, Western Highlands Province, Papua New Guinea
Origin_String: Waghi Valley, Western Highlands Province, Papua New Guinea
Name: Papua New Guinea PB Kimel Estate
Review: A particularly elegant Papua New Guinea peaberry coffee: juicy-sweet and crisply tart, finely balanced from aroma to finish.

Name: Panama La Esmeralda Noria Enero Geisha
Review: A complex expression of Gesha’s potential beauty, with lush florals, sweet and tart fruit notes, and crisp cocoa throughout.

Name: Rwanda Bufcafe
Review: One of the most impressive Rwanda coffees to have reached our cupping table in years: crisp, deeply sweet and balanced, with a resonant savory/umami throughline.

Origin: San Fernando, Nueva Segovia Department, Nicaragua
Origin_String: San Fernando, Nueva Segovia Department, Nicaragua
Name: Nicaragua Reserve Los Congos Pacamara Washed Process
Review: Deep yet delicate, sweet yet crisp, quietly complex, a fine essay on subtlety and balance.

Origin: San Fernando, Nueva Segovia Department, Nicaragua
Origin_String: San Fernando, Nueva Segovia Department, Nicaragua
Name: Nicaragua Reserve Los Congos Pacamara Natural Process
Review: Deep, sweet-toned dried-in-the-fruit profile, with a rum and floral intrigue.

Origin: Yirgacheffe growing region, southern Ethiopia; Central America
Origin_String: Yirgacheffe growing region, southern Ethiopia; Central America
Name: Sweet Breeze 17
Review: For those who value sweetness in a subtly complex coffee expression.

Name: Ethiopia Queen Sheba Natural Yirgacheffe Phoenix Special
Review: Invitingly rich and balanced as a straight shot; deeply chocolaty with floral notes as cappuccino.

Name: Single-Origin Espresso Medium Roast
Review: A roast-dominated but rich, quietly complex single-origin espresso from Thailand for those who enjoy dark-roasted coffees that maintain sweetness and character.

Name: Ulos Batak Sumatra Peaberry
Review: An exquisite experience of Sumatra coffee: exotic, deeply sweet, umami-rich.

Name: Bernachon High-Level Espresso
Review: A big, expressive, sweet-tart espresso blend, quite chocolaty in milk.

Name: Bernachon MB Espresso
Review: A complex, layered, chocolate- and spice-toned espresso blend, particularly appealing in milk.

Name: Bernachon ZG Espresso
Review: A boldly aromatic espresso blend with a citrus-toned chocolate throughline.

Name: Bernachon Classic Espresso
Review: A straightforward, accessible and inexpensive espresso blend.

Name: Mora Negra Geisha Hartmann Farm
Review: An elegant natural-processed rendition of the classic Gesha cup, with notes of floral-toned musk and cocoa revealed in complex layers.

Name: Gori Gesha Forest
Review: A bold, sweetly spice-toned natural-processed Gesha from Ethiopia, the origin of this famous and still rare coffee variety.

Origin: Sidikalang, Lintong growing region, northern Sumatra, Indonesia
Origin_String: Sidikalang, Lintong growing region, northern Sumatra, Indonesia
Name: Sumatra Wahana Estate
Review: A big, resonant, sweetly earth-toned and floral Sumatra coffee.

Name: Thai Single-Origin Natural-Processed Espresso
Review: A natural-processed espresso that will appeal to those who enjoy a lush sweet fruit ferment framed in chocolate and dry nut.

Name: Thai Single-Origin Honey-Processed Espresso
Review: An invitingly crisp, brightly sweet-tart espresso, impressively chocolaty and floral-toned in milk.

Name: Thai Single-Origin A4+A4.5+A5 Espresso Blend
Review: A crisply sweet-tart, fruit- and floral-toned espresso blend.

Name: Thai Single-Origin A4+A5 Espresso Blend
Review: A pleasantly dry, accessible, balanced espresso.

Name: Ethiopia Banko Dhadhato
Review: An impressive citrus and sweet spice-toned Yirgacheffe cup, impressively certified: both organic and Fair Trade.

Origin: Hambela Wamena District, Guji Zone, Oromia region, southern Ethiopia
Origin_String: Hambela Wamena District, Guji Zone, Oromia region, southern Ethiopia
Name: Ethiopia Hambela Grade 1 Natural
Review: An inviting and accessible natural-processed Ethiopia: crisp, sweet-tart and delicate.

Origin: Hambela Wamena District, Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Origin_String: Hambela Wamena District, Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Name: Ethiopia Natural Hambela Buku
Review: An intricately layered, elegantly rich natural-processed Ethiopia cup.

Origin: Piedra Candela, Chiriqui Province, far western Panama
Origin_String: Piedra Candela, Chiriqui Province, far western Panama
Name: Panama Camilina Natural Geisha
Review: A lovely natural-processed Gesha from a highly regarded farm: elegant, lively, flavor-laden.

Name: Kenya Nyeri Thageini Peaberry
Review: An unusually gentle yet fully expressed variation on the Kenya theme of lush, berryish sweetness fused with the crisply savory. Its grace, sweetness, and soft but lively acidity makes it one of the more accessible Kenyas we have cupped for some time.

Name: Single-Origin Nitro
Review: Our highest-rated cold brew to date: complex, vibrant, elegant.

Name: Tempo Nitro
Review: Sweetly tart, crisply complete; a cold brew classic in its confident presentation.

Name: House Blend #1
Review: A sweet-toned blend carried by notes of ripe stone fruit and rich nut butter.

Name: Rhythm Nitro
Review: A refreshing chocolate-toned cold brew laced with fresh-cut cedar.

Name: Los Popitos Honduras
Review: An unconventional, rather original cup, woody yet sweet, with engaging crisp nut and baker’s chocolate notes.

Name: No. 5 Espresso Blend
Review: An appealing blend for those who value a savory, salty chocolate straight shot that softens and sweetens in cappuccino-scaled milk.

Name: Hawaii Kilauea Volcano Nano-Lot
Review: An extraordinary coffee with very limited availability: exotically aromatic, balanced, uniquely composed.

Name: Ethiopia Charbanta Natural
Review: An exciting natural Yirgacheffe cup, both classic in brightly sweet structure and exotic in lush, complex detail.

Name: Panama Don Julian Pacamara
Review: A Pacamara on steroids, in the best possible sense, with butterscotch and lavender, in particular, in 3-D.

Name: Esmeralda Noria Natural
Review: A costly but rare and prestigious gift for the coffee-lover who values intricate yet elegant natural-processed Geshas.

Name: Miami Winter Holiday Blend
Review: One of the loveliest blends we tested in 2016, distinguished by rich aromatics and appealing tropical flavor notes.

Name: Duncan Estate Panamanian Gesha
Review: A very pretty citrus-toned Gesha, packaged for the holidays in a reusable glass jar. Organic to boot.

Origin: Limu Woreda, Oromia Zone, southern Ethiopia
Origin_String: Limu Woreda, Oromia Zone, southern Ethiopia
Name: Ethiopia Limu
Review: A lovely, balanced natural-processed Ethiopia from Limu, a growing area less-known than the iconic Yirgacheffe and Sidamo regions.

Name: El Burro Geisha Washed “Tachi”
Review: An unusual Gesha, more nut-toned than floral, hearty rather than delicate, likely to particularly appeal to those who prefer a slightly darker-roasted presentation of this celebrated coffee variety.

Name: Sweet Holiday Blend
Review: A classic coffee blend, sweet and rich, packaged in a hand-printed bag featuring local art, and one in a series of Red Rooster’s special Advent calendar coffee releases.

Origin: Holualoa, North Kona growing district, “Big Island” of Hawaii
Origin_String: Holualoa, North Kona growing district, “Big Island” of Hawaii
Name: Kahiko Holiday Coffee
Review: A classic revival of the original Kona strain of Typica: sweet-tart fruit notes and rich chocolate and florals. Limited availability.

Origin: Sidama (also Sidamo) growing region, southern Ethiopia
Origin_String: Sidama (also Sidamo) growing region, southern Ethiopia
Name: Gigisa Ethiopia
Review: A spice-toned natural-processed Ethiopia, packaged in an apothecary bottle as a vitamin might be, suggesting the health benefits of good coffee.

Name: Poinsettia Blend
Review: A compelling holiday blend, named for the popular winter-season flower: sweet, spicy, richly floral.

Name: The Jungle
Review: Pleasingly crisp and complex as a straight shot, but particularly impressive in cappuccino-scaled milk, where the shot blossoms vibrantly without losing complexity.

Name: Natural Brazil “Hat Magic” Phoenix Special
Review: A particularly deep, balanced straight shot, accessible, satisfying, resonant.

Origin: Guanga District, Yirgacheffe growing region, southern Ethiopia
Origin_String: Guanga District, Yirgacheffe growing region, southern Ethiopia
Name: Ethiopia Yirgacheffe Natural Celinga Foge Grade 1
Review: A big, resonant dried-in-the-fruit Yirgacheffe, brightly fruit-toned and lushly floral.

Origin: Sabanilla de Alajuela, Central Valley, Costa Rica
Origin_String: Sabanilla de Alajuela, Central Valley, Costa Rica
Name: Costa Rica Las Lajas Alma Negra
Review: A discreet ferment turns the fruit toward cider in this crisp natural-process Costa Rica.

Name: Colombian
Review: An impressive dark roast, round, balanced and chocolate- and plum-toned.

Name: Costa Rica Medium Roast
Review: A soft, quiet-spoken darker roast, gently chocolaty and raisin-toned.

Name: Christmas Blend
Review: A solid blend with holiday appeal: nut-toned chocolate and vanilla-like florals.

Name: Ethiopia Yirgacheffe
Review: A crisp, delicate, tartly floral-toned coffee with particularly intriguing berry and citrus suggestions.

Name: Panama Santa Teresa Natural
Review: An intense but balanced natural-processed Panama coffee, fruit-driven and deeply floral.

Name: Light Roast
Review: An appealing coffee for those who appreciate crisp fruit in a chocolaty and subtly floral cup.

Name: Ethiopia Washed Yirgacheffe “Paradise” Espresso
Review: A big, round, intense floral- and chocolate-driven Yirgacheffe espresso.

Name: Taiwan Taiwu Pingtung Natural Typica
Review: A crisp, citrus-toned, chocolaty espresso with an engaging story and origin. Particularly fine as a straight shot.

Name: Velvet Fog
Review: A good choice for those who appreciate a tactfully dark-roasted blend that maintains its fruit and chocolate notes throughout the profile, with support from deep spice tones.

Origin: Sabanilla de Alajuela growing region, Costa Rica
Origin_String: Sabanilla de Alajuela growing region, Costa Rica
Name: Costa Rica Las Lajas Red Honey
Review: A sweetly crisp, accessible honey-processed Costa Rica cup.

Name: Thanksgiving Blend
Review: A fine holiday blend for those who favor darker-roasted coffees with gentle acidity and rich chocolate notes.

Name: Kenya Lenana
Review: Reminiscent in part of a very sophisticated essence of root beer float, this attractive Kenya is deep, sweet and richly smooth.

Name: Selected Espresso Blend
Review: Solid, quietly complex espresso, animated by a sweet aromatic wood and backgrounded chocolate.

Name: “Mini-Me” Washed Yirgacheffe
Review: An exhilarating single-origin Yirgacheffe espresso: classically balanced; richly sweet, elegant and engaging.

Origin: Toraja growing region, south-central Sulawesi, Indonesia
Origin_String: Toraja growing region, south-central Sulawesi, Indonesia
Name: Toarco Jaya Sulawesi
Review: An invitingly juicy, yet intriguingly sweet-savory Sulawesi coffee.

Name: Kenya Guama Peaberry
Review: An exuberant expression of the classic Kenya cup: sweetly pungent, deeply rich, laden with berry and spicy floral suggestions throughout.

Origin: Lintong growing region, northern Sumatra, Indonesia
Origin_String: Lintong growing region, northern Sumatra, Indonesia
Name: Sumatra Tano Batak
Review: A deeply aromatic, invitingly tart wet-hulled Sumatra cup, with characteristic notes of sweet pipe tobacco and rich tropical fruit tones.

Name: Los Congos Pacamara Natural
Review: Exciting array of sweet fruit and nut notes, livened by orange zest and grounded by suggestions of rich pipe tobacco.

Name: Ethiopia Washed Shatawene Gr. 1
Review: An invitingly accessible, crisply sweet Sidamo cup.

Name: Ethiopia Yirgacheffe Worka Coop Gedeb
Review: An engaging coffee particularly appealing to those who value delicate, cocoa-toned coffees with gentle acidity and engaging spice notes. Reassuring environmental and socio-economic credentials.

Name: Paul’s Blend
Review: A solid blend that offers deep fruit notes with sweet nut and aromatic wood complications. Reassuring environmental and socio-economic credentials.

Name: Kibugu Kenya
Review: A classic Kenya cup: deeply floral, with a pleasing, richly resonant balance of sweet and savory.

Name: Flight Seasonal Espresso
Review: An appealing espresso blend: deeply sweet, invitingly savory, with a fruit-tartness suggesting pomegranate.

Name: Don Pepe Costa Rica
Review: A you-know-who-you-are coffee. Those who enjoy big, sweetly fermenty, fruit-forward coffees (usually natural-processed; here honey-processed) will like this one. Those purists whose ideal is a fresh, cleanly bright, classic cup most likely will not like this one.

Origin: Valle del Cauca growing region, Colombia
Origin_String: Valle del Cauca growing region, Colombia
Name: Granja La Esperanza Colombia
Review: A resonantly aromatic Pacamara cup with a sweetly savory throughline and inviting rich chocolate complication.

Name: Cielo El Salvador
Review: Quietly original in its layering of sweet flowers, tart fruit and spicy ginger suggestions.

Origin: Toraja growing region, South Sulawesi, Indonesia
Origin_String: Toraja growing region, South Sulawesi, Indonesia
Name: Sulawesi Tana Toraja
Review: Elegantly exotic and bold. Should appeal to those who enjoy rich, flavor-saturated, deeply nuanced coffees.

Name: Life Saver Guatemala Organic Finca La Colina
Review: A solid Guatemala cup: deeply sweet, with a chocolate throughline.

Name: Panama Elida Natural Lot #26
Review: A sweetly and discreetly fermenty cup that will appeal to those who enjoy lushly fruit-toned coffees with cocoa and aromatic wood complication.

Origin: Holualoa, North Kona growing district, “Big Island” of Hawaii
Origin_String: Holualoa, North Kona growing district, “Big Island” of Hawaii
Name: Mokka
Review: A rare coffee from an extraordinary, low-bearing variety that is worth the premium you’ll pay for its originality and intense, intricate aromas and flavors.

Origin: Holualoa, North Kona growing district, “Big Island” of Hawaii
Origin_String: Holualoa, North Kona growing district, “Big Island” of Hawaii
Name: 100% Kona High Mountain Io Fancy
Review: A Kona cup both classically balanced yet distinctive in its sweet herb and floral tones and backgrounded dark chocolate.

Name: Kenya Gathugu
Review: A compelling classic Kenya coffee, perfectly suspended between sweet and savory, sweetly tart yet deeply rich.

Name: Pacamara Finca Los Planes El Salvador
Review: A quietly exciting Pacamara cup, both delicate and rich, with exotic floral (plumeria) and fruit (loquat) notes throughout.

Name: Kenya Windrush AB
Review: A delicate but vivid Kenya cup; should particularly appeal to those who enjoy crisp, sweet-savory juxtapositions in food and beverages.

Name: Panama Dos Ruedas
Review: A finely balanced, melodic espresso, satiny in the small cup and sweetly seductive in milk.
